item.title: ruleguard rules package management
item.description: Bundles is a new feature coming to the ruleguard. It’ll make it possible to re-use third-party rules without having to copy/paste them. Creating an importable bundle A package that exports rules must define a Bundle object: package gorules import "github.com/quasilyte/go-ruleguard/dsl" // Bundle holds the rules package metadata. // // In order to be importable from other gorules package, // a package must define a Bundle variable. var Bundle = dsl.Bundle{} func boolComparison(m dsl.

item.title: ruleguard: dynamic inspection rules for Go
item.description: If you found a typo or a misspelling, please [file an issue](https://github.com/quasilyte/blog-src/issues/new) or send a PR that fixes it. Original (ru): https://habr.com/post/481696/. This article introduces a new static analysis library (and CLI utility) go-ruleguard. It’s like a gogrep that is adapted for the use inside your CI pipeline. You describe static analysis rules in terms of a special Go-like DSL. During the startup, ruleguard turns these definitions into a set of inspections to be executed.
